CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 29, 1955, pg. A8 reads: "NAACP Protest Rally: 3,000 Hear Emmett Till Case Facts; Give; Urge United States to Act - Lodging Protests - Among the approximately 3,000 signatures on the petition being mailed to Attorney-General Brownell, were those of Sadiq Ali of 1715 Bedford Avenue, and Mrs. Charles Ware of 7442 Cassina Way, who are shown signing in presence of (left to right) Mrs. Joan Hawthorne, Mary Peace, and Theresa Weaver of the Vanettes Social Club who assisted the NAACP. All Photos by Harris.
TitMainTitle: Sadiq Ali wearing long beard and dark fedora, and Mrs. Charles Ware, signing document on NAACP table, in front of Joan Hawthorne, Mary Peace, and Theresa Weaver, in Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall for NAACP protest rally
CatSubject_tab: Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall (Pittsburgh, Pa.)
